name: Hotel Teatro Di Pompeo

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in November of 2012. Booked on-line and was very happy with the find. Hotel is near Campo dei Fiori and all the major sites. Location is off the beaten path, a little hard to find, but well worth the search. Our room was in the annex, which is across the cobblestone square, which was good and bad. Good in that the room was of decent size, on the third floor of the building, no lift. Very clean. Any complaints I had were taken care of immediately. Bad in that there is no wifi, and we spent every evening in the lobby of the main hotel catching up with friends, family, etc....and after a week, the three flights of narrow stairs started to take a toll on this tired traveler!!! Very small TV in the room, but great storage, room size, refridgerator and huge bathroom!!!
reviews.title: Great find

reviews.text: Very nice front desk staff. Great breakfast. Will return, but would request a room in the main hotel.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice shopping area just outside your door. Great restaurants in the Campo dei fiori area.
reviews.title: Beautiful Room Welcomed us to Rome

reviews.text: The location of Teatro di Pompeo can hardly be beaten, as it is just 5-10 minutes by foot from sights such as Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Campo dei Fiori. What is more, the buses going to the Vatican or the The Colosseum and the railway station stop very close to the hotel.
reviews.title: Best place in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are pretty average in an international comparison, but remember that hotels in Rome's centro storico are notoriously expensive so the rooms at Teatro di Pompeo are definitely good value - but do not expect a modern luxurious room. However, my room was very quiet with a comfortable bed, and that is the most important part. Extra plus for free WiFi in the rooms, as that is still not too common in Italy.
reviews.title: Charming with perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel boasts an excellent location in the heart of historic Rome.
reviews.title: Great location for touring Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were within an easy walk of nearly everything (except the Sistine/Vatican), and with many dining options nearby.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room (#10) just off reception, which, when we closed the second inner door to our room, made for a very quiet stay!
reviews.title: Location, Location!

reviews.text: Breakfast is a nice spread that includes cold cuts, yoghurt, cheeses, pastries, tea or coffee.
reviews.title: Excellent 3-star in the center of Rome

reviews.text: Prices are in line with Rome (so not cheap) but the location more than makes up for it.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 6 nights at Hotel Teatro Di Pompeo and were very impressed. The rooms are very big and comfortable and the location is excellent. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: An excellent location

reviews.text: I came back to the Hotel Teatro di Pompeo. And it was great, location, service, and everything. Steps from Campo di Fiori and Piazza Navona, and Via Julia, can walk to Trastevere and to the Vaticano... I will keep choosing it when going to Roma! The building is very cute, with the breakfast room built in the ruins. WiFi as ok, the room as very spacious, facing the street, staff was very helpfull.
reviews.title: Again, a good choice when in Roma

reviews.text: My mother and I stayed two nights at this small hotel while we visited Rome and we really liked it. The location was excellent and you could walk to all the major sights in the city. What we were really thankful for was the staff, especially the female front desk clerk (sorry I forgot her name!) who advised us of the general transit strike that would effect our journey. She also volunteered useful tourist information and a map so we could get around. Breakfast was served in the old teatro and was good and the rooms were comfortable with a/c. We quickly learned to inquire if hotels were staffed 24 hrs at the front desk, and this hotel is. There are numerous restuarants nearby, one next door with a fixed menu and price of $25. Service is rushed but the food was great.
reviews.title: Great Location and helpful staff

reviews.text: Teatro di pompeo, the hotel calls itself - and rightly so. Built on the very spot where ancient theater goers dwelled in gardens and colonnades. Breakfast is in the cellar. With every meter down you go back a century in time. And you know that down there there is still more. Awesome. And of course: very good tourist location, adequate rooms, nice service.
reviews.title: The thrill of history

reviews.text: The hotel is located right in the middle if the historical center, extremely convenient walking distance to just about everything. The room was nice, decent size by Roman standards. Could not get WiFi in the room, had to go to the lobby which was the only, minor issue. The staff was friendly, spoke good English and the property clean and well maintained. Next door is a great little restaurant and within few block several excellent ones. We looked out over the front but the room was still quiet, inside, outside shutters kept the noise down.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.text: Right behind Campo de Fiori so within walking distance to everything essential. We had a room in a different building right around the corner from the main hotel, which was fine for us, but it was on the second floor with a very narrow staircase and no lift. Make sure you have a room in the main building if you have any physical disabilities (or heavy suitcase!). Both buildings on a quite square, so no noise from outside. Spacious and clean room with good beds. Quite good breakfast in the very charming cellar which is part of the old theatre.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: Stayed Hotel Di Pompeo for the second time in May 2012 since had liked it the first time . Love it! What makes this hotel exceptionally nice is the staff lead by Simona and Paolo. They are extremely nice, helpful and fun and they gave us restaurant recommendations, taxi help, advice about Rome--anything they could do to make our visit better, they did! The location is excellent, 10 minute walk to Pantheon, Piazza Navona and 2 minutes to Campo dei Fiori. The hotel is very clean and comfortable rooms are good size, bathrooms up to date and all is spotless! Anytime in Rome I will be at Teatro Di Pompeo! I hope to return in the not too distant future!
reviews.title: Hotel Teatro di Pompeo is great!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right near Campo Di Fiore and the Centro Storico. Great location. Easy walk to all the restaurants around Piazza Navonna too. We were there for a wedding and had four nights there in July. It was hot, but the AC worked great. Much better than the Airport Hilton where we stayed our last night (6am flight). All the staff spoke great English so I didn't get to practice my Italian. Breakfast is in the Grotto, part of the excavations of Pompey's theater which occupied this block. I didn't notice any noise from the street, but could hear noise from the other rooms. Luckily I brought a sound machine. The rooms are quite large, really extrordinary from other hotels I've stayed in Rome, New York, London or even Los Angeles. Will definitely plan a return!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights here and loved it. Due to the location of the hotel, we could walk everywhere. The staff were very helpful and spoke English and French. We had an inside room but it was very quiet and having breakfast amid the ruins of a Roman theatre was fun (and the breakfast was fine.) We had free wifi for the computer which was also convenient. We hope to return one day.
reviews.title: perfect location for visiting ancient Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a very enjoyable four night stay in this lovely hotel. This was our third time to stay at this hotel. We had a beautiful room overlooking the little piazza at Largo del Pallaro. The windows and shutters in the bedroom block out all street noise and light which enabled us to sleep extremely well. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the breakfasts are good too. This hotel is so convenient for touring Rome and we walked everywhere from it. Our only problem was that neither or our smart phones could connect into the Hotel's free WiFi. We asked three different members of staff, none of whom solve this problem. We were disappointed, considering the amount of money we handed over for our stay. The WiFi worked very well on our phones in hotels throughout Tuscany, prior to our arrival in Rome.
reviews.title: We returned for our third visit and it's still great!
Great for cuples, noisy on saturday night.
reviews.text: A group of 6 (3 couples) stayed in Feb 06. Check in was quick and efficient. The room basic but comfortable and clean. Breakfast was again basic but adequate. The best thing about this hotel was its location 90% of the major sights were within easy walking distance and some fabulous restaurants within a few minutes walk. I would stay here again and have recommended to family and friends. The only downside was the sunday night noise from neighbours!!!!!!!!!! Quietened down at 3.00am. Small bar for pre dinner drinks and nightcaps.

Loved staying at this hotel. We were with a group of friends, but my son and I were put in the annexe which I thought would be disappointing as it's across the street - but it was a lovely peaceful room overlooking the hotel and the church - other than the 2 long flights of stairs (no elevator!) , highly recommended. Staff very helpful, breakfasts amazing. Would definitely go back. Enjoyed eating with Paola (of Rick Steves fame) in her restaurant next door to hotel.
reviews.title: Peaceful annexe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But I would book earlier so we could be in the main building. Overall it was a very good experience. The location was ideal. Very clean and all of the staff friendly and helpful. I think the breakfast was probably better than most . We knew we were booked into the annex but had somehow gotten the impression it was one flight of stairs. We were in the room at the very top and that was 51 steps. The last flight was narrow and steep with a sharp corner. Since we were traveling for two weeks we had large and heavy suitcases. I suggest they either make it clear that it is not an easy flight of stairs and /or provide a porter. Once we figured out how to reprogram the air conditioner we were comfortable. We never were able to get the TV on, but we weren't in Rome to watch TV. It was just that being away from the main building it wasn't as easy to get help. That said I would choose Teatro di Pompeo again..
reviews.title: We would choose the Teatro di Pompeo again.
A great little hotel
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed 5 nights here, between June 27 and July 2. This hotel, overall, was the nicest of the three on our vacation. The room was large, clean and quite. We stayed on the third floor, and had a view out our window of an old church dome. The only noise I ever heard from outside was seagulls cawing in the early morning. The hallways are small, and only once or twice did I hear other guests from outside our doorway. Besides the main bedroom, there was a second small room with a roll up bed. My daughter used this as her own bedroom. The bathroom was clean, large enough for the two of us, and had relatively new facilities. The room came with a mini fridge, which was handy to store food purchased and leftovers. The TV was very small, but we spent little time watching it (my daughter mainly enjoyed watching Italian MTV). The breakfasts in the grotto below the main floor were relatively large (though not full service) and more than my daughter or I usually ate. My daughter also enjoyed that the hotel had a computer in the lobby/bar area for guest use, though there was a euro per 15 minute charge. We saw many staff members during our stay, and they were generally helpful and friendly. I particularly appreciate the services of one gentleman (whose name unfortunately I do not remember) who helped us tremendously when my daughter lost her wallet (though it was never found).

The hotel is centrally located in a small piazza near the Campo di Fiori. We were able to walk to most sights, but the weather was hot, and we took a few taxis during the afternoons. The way to the hotel is off small alleys, and it took us a couple of days to go to and from without getting lost and needing our map. The hotel is nothing to look at from the outside, but very nice from the inside, with tile floors and wood panneled ceilings in our room. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to any one looking for a nice reasonablly priced, centrally located hotel in Rome.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: A really good location and we were impressed with their helpfulness. I just wish we had stayed in the main hotel. Instead they had a room for us across the little piazza in the top floor of a private building with apartments. We had one key that opened the door from the street, then we went down a long hallway and then to the left began the first set of stairs to where we popped out to the backside of the building with entrances to apartments, but it looked really like being in an alley with laundry hanging everywhere. We then had another key for the door that accesses the 4 rooms that the hotel owns. Well this is where the real awkward part begins. If you have climbed the inside of a duomo of a church you will get the picture right away. The door opens to a narrow marble staircase so if you have large luggage it will not be fun. Then you go up a bunch of stairs and there are 2 doors for rooms and then you turn and head up another flight and there is a room and then a few more stairs and down a tiny hall with a window and we were finally at our room. It was a corner room, very large with many windows, a huge bed and A/C. It was pretty quiet as well! The bathroom and closet area was large and for a romantic spot it was great. I just fear that if you had no idea like we had when the hotel told us when we were making reservations that they had a nice room in their annex for us that there would be so many stairs and no help with the bags then it would be huge issue. Not to mention the price since we were not in the main hotel that had an elevator and we had so many stairs to climb. The breakfast was good and the helpfulness of the staff was impeccable. I wished I could offer you my opinion of the hotel room in the main part but I guess I'll have to see next time I visit Rome.
reviews.title: Large Room in Annex but Beware Lots of awkward stairs to climb up

reviews.text: I picked the Hotel Teatro Di Pompeo primarily because of its location. It was my first time in Rome, the hotel seemed central to everything, and the previous reviews were very positive. I just didn't realize how very very central the hotel was!!!! It was the best place to stay for someone who had never been to Rome before - easy walking distance to all the main sites, and in the "heart" of a pretty happening area. The hotel rooms were very nice & clean - and I'm very picky! Nothing "fancy", but definitely very simple & relaxing. The hotel was very historic, and it was great to eat in the "cave" in the morning. The breakfast fare was good (for Italy), and the hotel staff were very friendly & accommodating. If I go to Rome, I am definitely going to try to stay there again!
reviews.title: Great way to end vacation in Italy!
Fine Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights with my wife and had no complaints whatsoever. We had a 3rd floor room that had an interior view (we could see the church dome). This was our first time in Rome so we hadn't much to compare it too but the room was clean and comfortable with the bathroom separated from the sleeping area. The staff was professional and friendly. We walked to most sites but taxied to the Vatican. Good selection of restaurants nearby and the car service to the airport (55 euros) was on time and a stress free way to leave the city. Recommend staying here.

The hotel has an excellent location, close to Piazza Navona, Campo dei Fiori, and the Pantheon, and is reasonably priced in comparison with other 3-star hotels in the same area. Rooms and bathrooms are clean, spacious and well equipped (TV set, minibar, tub and shower, toiletries). The rooms' wooden ceilings are beautiful but thin so you get some noise from the people above you. Otherwise the rooms are well insulated from outside noise. Bring your earplugs if your sleep is light. The hotel should improve its breakfast, which is rather disappointing.
reviews.title: Excellent location
Great location and don't miss the trattoria next door
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location - a quiet (except for Saturday night) square just off Campo di Fiori, near Piazza Novana. The area is utterly charming and full of Romans rather than tourists.

reviews.title: Nice Rooms But Thin Walls
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Hotel. I was impressed with the size of the rooms and throught the value was good for the price (we paid 135 Euro per night under a hotel special for three nights or more). However, the walls are very thin and we did not get any sleep during one of the nights since we could hear noises from the room above and next to us. It is in a good location, but if you are a light sleeper you may want to try another hotel.

My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Teatro Di Pompeo for three nights. Before arriving I arranged via email for their shuttle service. However, when we arrived there was no shuttle. So we took the train. The hotel concierge said I had given her the wrong arrival time. I had the original email with the correct time, but decided to let it pass.
reviews.title: Great location
great location
reviews.text: The rest of our experience was perfect. The hotel is in a great location. The room was clean, and a good size. The evening concierge was very helpful with restaurant suggestions, even making reservations for us. The breakfast was excellent, and it was a nice experience dining in the old theatre ruins. Overall a great stay.

A superb location within the Cenrto Storico, especially good for short stays, as you can stumble across much by just walking around a different corner of the tiny piazza on which the hotel is sited. Efficient and calm service. Typically small rooms, but with a cared-for feel.
reviews.title: Ideal location for exploring Rome

reviews.text: Rome is a sprawling and chaotic city and this hotel provides the best location for exploring most of the major sites. My husband & I did plenty of research on a location and we thought this was the ideal spot to explore most of Rome by foot.
reviews.title: Quiet, Clean, and Close to Everything
Excellent- Great Location
reviews.text: The hotel is part of an old roman theater from 55BC. The location can't be beat. You are right next to church of Sant'Andrea della Valle. This is the church that where the opening scene of Tosca takes place. You are minutes away from the Pantheon, and the Piazza Navona.
The rooms were not huge but perfectly adequate, and it did have a small TV. The breakfast is ok, but for the price, and the location, you have to be pleased with the hotel.
reviews.title: Loved the place

likes.liked: — Its vaulted basement and the fact it had cool air conditioning.
likes.disliked: — Turning around to park the car.

reviews.text: Right next to the hotel, on the right when facing the hotel, is a restaurant that offers a set meal for only 22Euros a person with wine. It was very good.
reviews.title: Good choice for first visit to Rome
Another good experience
reviews.text: Nice place in the heart of Rome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed the air conditioning - after 3 nights in a place without it.
reviews.title: A very fine hotel

description: THE TEATRO DI POMPEO HOTEL IS LOCATED ON THE REMAINS OF THE ANCIENT ROMAN POMPEY'S THEATRE DATING BACK TO THE YEAR 55 B.C. IT IS SITUATED IN THE HEART OF ROME'S HISTORICAL CENTRE, JUST FEW STEPS FROM PIAZZA NAVONA AND CAMPO DE' FIORI. GUESTS MAY ENJOY BREAKFAST AND DRINKS IN PRESENCE OF ANCIENT ROMAN REMAINS. THE HOTEL IS DEDICATED TO SELECT AND EXACTING GUESTS WHO APPRECIATE QUALITY COMFORT AND EXCELLENT SERVICE.
